Class WordleGUI

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
java.awt.Window
java.awt.Frame
javax.swing.JFrame
WordleGUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActionListener, ImageObserver, MenuContainer, Serializable, EventListener, Accessible, RootPaneContainer, WindowConstants
public class WordleGUI extends JFrame implements ActionListener
A GUI recreation for the Wordle game, providing an interface for players to submit guesses and view previous submissions. This class handles the creation and layout of the game's UI components, including panels, labels, text fields, and text areas.
Version:
1.0
Author:
kbogott
See Also:
  • WordleDriver
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • WordleGUI

      public WordleGUI()
      Initializes a new instance of the WordleGUI class, creating the main game frame and its components. This constructor sets up the layout, adds panels and components, and configures the game's UI.

  • Method Details

    • getIsPlayAgain

      public boolean getIsPlayAgain()
      Returns isPlayAgain boolean value based on if user wants to replay or not.
      Returns:
      isPlayAgain boolean value

    • actionPerformed

      public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e)
      Handles the event when the user presses the Enter key.

      This method takes in the user's input, checks if it's a valid 5-letter word, and checks if it's been submitted before. If the input is valid, it adds it to the list of previous guesses, changes the color of the inputted letters based on if they belong in the word or not, and checks if the guess is correct or not. If the guess is correct, it displays a win message. If the guess is incorrect, it displays a message indicating the number of attempts left.

      Specified by:
      actionPerformed in interface ActionListener
      Parameters:
      e - the event to be processed , when the enter button is pressed

    • resetGameState

      public void resetGameState()
      Resets the game state to its initial state. This method resets the number of guesses, gameOver, previous guesses list, showcase letter colors, and answer history pane. It also re-enables the input field for user input.
      See Also:
      • restartGame()

    • restartGame

      public void restartGame()
      Restarts the game by resetting the game state and generating a new random word. This method calls resetGameState to reset all game variables and then generates a new random word from the word array.
      See Also:
      • resetGameState()

    • isRight

      public boolean isRight(String answer, String userInput)
      Checks if the user's input is correct or not.
      Parameters:
      answer - the correct 5-letter word
      userInput - the user's 5-letter word submission
      Returns:
      true if the input is correct, false otherwise

    • changeShowcaseLetterColor

      public void changeShowcaseLetterColor(String userInput)
      Changes the color of the letters that have been guessed. Based on if the letter is in the target word. Changed to Green if letter is in word Changed to Gray if not in word
      Parameters:
      userInput - The user's five-letter word submission | String

    • addPrevInputToPanel

      public void addPrevInputToPanel(String userInput)
      Adds the user's previous input to the panel, with each letter colored based on its correctness. Green indicates a correct letter in the correct position, yellow indicates a correct letter in an incorrect position, and red indicates an incorrect letter.
      Parameters:
      userInput - the user's 5-letter word submission

    • hasBeenSubmitted

      public boolean hasBeenSubmitted(String userInput)
      Checks if the user's input has been previously submitted or not.
      Parameters:
      userInput - the user's 5-letter word submission
      Returns:
      true if the input has been previously submitted, false otherwise
